resources.string: Welcome to the Drifting Quiz!\nAn easy warmup question:\nWhat does DK stands for?
A car is said to be drifting when:
The rear slip angle is greater than the front slip angle, and the front wheels are pointing in the opposite direction to the turn
The front slip angle is greater than the rear slip angle, and the front wheels are pointing in the opposite direction to the turn
The rear slip angle is greater than the front slip angle, and the front wheels are pointing in the same direction to the turn
The rear slip angle is greater than the front slip angle, and the rear wheels are pointing in the opposite direction to the turn

Which drift-technique is done by swaying the car\'s weight back and forth on straight-aways, using counter steer and throttle to maintain a large angle?

Which drift-technique involves dropping the rear tires off the sealed road onto low-grip surface that borders the road to maintain or gain drift angle?
Kansei, Lift off, or Taking In
